item.title: The U.S. economy is getting closer to a recession. What is the Fed waiting for?
item.description: The Fed should cut rates by 0.5% before the Jackson Hole meeting in late August, says Investment manager Louis Navellier.

item.title: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin withdraws plea deal for accused 9/11 terrorists
item.description: The deal had been announced on Wednesday.

item.title: The market has a sinking feeling that the Fed has fallen behind the curve
item.description: The coming central-bank pivot won‚Äôt usher in a mere solo rate cut but a rate-cutting campaign.

item.title: Tech stocks see steepest three-week slump in two years, led by plunge in Amazon and Intel
item.description: With quarterly earnings largely in the rearview mirror, Wall Street is troubled by what it's seeing out of Silicon Valley.

item.title: Dow closes down 600 points, Nasdaq enters correction after weak jobs report: Live updates
item.description: Stocks slid Friday as a much weaker-than-anticipated jobs report for July ignited worries that the economy could be falling into a recession.

item.title: Wall Street will look for signs of what's next for the market after a rocky start to August
item.description: Stocks plunged to kick off the month after a weak jobs report added to fears of slowing growth and revised the monetary policy outlook.

item.title: Ex-Google engineers who founded Character.AI rejoin company with new AI partnership
item.description: One of the founders previously criticized the tech giant for moving too cautiously to release artificial intelligence products.

item.title: Nasdaq enters correction territory as recession fears slam stocks
item.description: Friday‚Äôs stock-market pullback saw the Nasdaq Composite enter correction territory.

item.title: Hunter Biden criminal gun case sentencing set for Nov. 13, after presidential election
item.description: Hunter Biden, son of President Joe Biden, will not be sentenced in his gun case until after the election between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

item.title: Intel has worst day on Wall Street in 50 years, falls to lowest price in over a decade
item.description: Intel shares cratered on Friday, dragging down Asian stocks including Samsung and TSMC as well as other chipmakers.

item.title: Stocks rocked by surprisingly soft U.S. jobs report as Nasdaq slides into correction
item.description: Investors dumped U.S. stocks on Friday, after a softer-than-expected jobs report heightened worries over slowing economic growth.

item.title: Eli Lilly's Zepbound and Mounjaro now available in U.S. after shortages, FDA says
item.description: Demand for weight loss and diabetes drugs has trounced supply for months, pushing Eli Lilly and rival Novo Nordisk to invest billions to ramp up manufacturing.

item.title: Google pulls AI ad for Olympics following backlash
item.description: Google was criticized for using artificial intelligence to write a fan letter to an Olympic athlete.
